title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
description: A foundational book that introduces design patterns in software engineering, providing solutions to common problems in software design.
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides

title: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey to Mastery
description: A guide to becoming a better programmer, focusing on practical techniques and best practices in software development.
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas

title: Domain-Driven Design: Tackling Complexity in the Heart of Software
description: This book provides a comprehensive approach to software development that focuses on the core domain and domain logic.
author: Eric Evans

title: Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
description: A guide to enterprise application architecture, providing patterns and best practices for building scalable and maintainable applications.
author: Martin Fowler

title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
description: This book teaches how to improve the design of existing code through refactoring techniques, making it easier to maintain and extend.
author: Martin Fowler

title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
description: A foundational text in computer science that teaches programming principles using the Scheme language.
author: Abraham Silberschatz, Peter B. Galvin, and Greg Gagne

title: Computer Systems: A Programmer's Perspective
description: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to computer systems from a programmer's perspective, covering hardware, software, and the interaction between them.
author: Randal E. Bryant and David R. O'Hallaron

title: The Algorithm Design Manual
description: A practical guide to algorithm design, featuring a unique catalog of algorithmic problems and solutions.
author: Steven S. Skiena

title: Mathematics for Computer Science
description: This book covers the mathematical foundations necessary for computer science, including logic, proofs, and combinatorics.
author: Eric Lehman, F. Thomson Leighton, and Albert R. Meyer

title: Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces
description: An accessible introduction to operating systems, covering key concepts and principles in a clear and engaging manner.
author: Remzi H. Arpaci-Dusseau and Andrea C. Arpaci-Dusseau

title: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach
description: A comprehensive introduction to computer networking, emphasizing a top-down approach to understanding network protocols and applications.
author: James Kurose and Keith Ross

title: Readings in Database Systems
description: A collection of influential papers in the field of database systems, providing insights into the evolution and current state of database technology.
author: Joseph M. Hellerstein, Michael Stonebraker, and James Hamilton

title: Crafting Interpreters
description: A hands-on guide to building programming languages and interpreters, suitable for beginners and experienced programmers alike.
author: Robert Nystrom

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
description: A comprehensive guide to building data-intensive applications, covering data models, storage systems, and distributed systems.
author: Martin Kleppmann

title: Computer Graphics From Scratch
description: An introduction to computer graphics programming, teaching the fundamentals of graphics through hands-on coding examples.
author: Gabriel Gambetta

title: Haskell Programming From First Principles
description: A comprehensive introduction to Haskell programming, designed for beginners and experienced programmers alike.
author: Christopher Allen and Julie Moronuki

title: Zero To Production In Rust
description: A practical guide to building production-ready applications in Rust, covering best practices and real-world examples.
author: Benny B. K. Kwan

title: A Philosophy of Software Design
description: A comprehensive guide on software design principles, emphasizing simplicity and abstraction.
author: John K Ousterhout

title: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey to Mastery
description: A classic book that provides practical advice for software developers, focusing on best practices and career development.
author: Andrew Hunt and David Thomas

title: Software Engineering at Google: Lessons Learned from Programming Over Time
description: Insights from Google engineers on software engineering practices, focusing on testing and code quality.
author: Titus Winters, Hyrum Wright, and Tom Manshreck

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications: The Big Ideas Behind Reliable, Scalable, and Maintainable Systems
description: A deep dive into the architecture of data-intensive applications, covering scalability and reliability.
author: Martin Kleppmann

title: An Elegant Puzzle: Systems of Engineering Management
description: A guide to engineering management, focusing on building and managing effective teams.
author: Will Larson

title: Best Software Design & Engineering
description: A collection of the best-selling books in software design and engineering, offering insights and methodologies for effective software development.
author: Various

title: Best Books on AI: From Beginner to Expert Level
description: A curated list of books that cover artificial intelligence from the basics to advanced concepts, suitable for all levels of learners.
author: Will Francis

title: 14 of the best books about Artificial Intelligence (AI)
description: An article listing fourteen essential books on artificial intelligence, providing a comprehensive overview of the field.
author: Tableau

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
description: A comprehensive textbook covering a wide range of AI topics including intelligent agents, problem-solving, machine learning, and natural language processing.
author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig

title: AI Superpowers: China, Silicon Valley, and the New World Order
description: An exploration of the global AI landscape, focusing on the competition between China and the US and its implications for the future.
author: Kai-Fu Lee

title: The Hundred-Page Machine Learning Book
description: A concise introduction to machine learning concepts, designed to be accessible and informative for beginners.
author: Andriy Burkov

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Guide to Intelligent Systems
description: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to the field of artificial intelligence, covering key concepts and techniques.
author: Michael Negnevitsky

title: Deep Learning
description: A comprehensive introduction to deep learning, covering the theory and practical applications of neural networks.
author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville

title: Python Machine Learning
description: This book provides a practical guide to machine learning with Python, covering various algorithms and techniques.
author: Sebastian Raschka, Vahid Mirjalili

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
description: This book covers the principles of designing scalable and maintainable data-intensive applications.
author: Martin Kleppmann

title: The Pragmatic Programmer: Your Journey To Mastery
description: A guide to becoming a better programmer, covering best practices and practical advice for software development.
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas

title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
description: This book teaches principles and best practices for writing clean, maintainable code.
author: Robert C. Martin

title: Artificial Intelligence: Foundations of Computational Agents
description: A comprehensive introduction to the foundations of artificial intelligence and computational agents.
author: David L. Poole, Alan K. Mackworth

title: Machine Learning Yearning
description: A practical guide to understanding how to structure machine learning projects.
author: Andrew Ng

title: The Art of Computer Programming, Volume 1: Fundamental Algorithms
description: This classic book covers fundamental algorithms and data structures in computer programming.
author: Donald E. Knuth

title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
description: An introduction to the theory of computation, covering automata, computability, and complexity.
author: Michael Sipser
